title: ERROR_VALUE
description: Returns the substitute_value if the provided value results in an error during evaluation. Otherwise, returns the original value. This function is useful for handling potential errors gracefully and ensuring that a default value is returned instead of an error.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The expression or value to evaluate.

parameters.name: substitute_value
parameters.description: The value to return if the evaluation of 'value' results in an error.

examples:
ERROR_VALUE(1/0, 0)
-- Returns 0 because dividing by zero results in an error.
tips: Use ERROR_VALUE to avoid formula failures caused by invalid calculations or missing data.
